metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29987 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
After requesting multiple permissions, and closing the first permission panel, subsequent permission panels will be displayed in a different position but still record a click in the default location, making it possible to trick a user into accepting a permission they did not want to. *This bug only affects Firefox on Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 91 and Thunderbird < 91.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29987` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
